p: In DCs, downregulation of costimulatory molecules following administration of IVIg has been observed. This is similar to B cells which exhibited a reduction in antigen-presentation activity secondary to IgG internalization, in concordance with a reduced IL-2 production by T cells [ 106]. Moreover, IVIg administration modulates B-cell receptor (BCR) signaling. In the study of Séïté et al. [ 107], authors found that interaction between BCR and CD22 resulted in a down-regulation of tyrosine phosphorylation of Lyn and the B-cell linker proteins which resulted in a sustained activation of Erk 1/2 and arrest of the cell cycle at the G/1 phase.
